AD_WINDOW.NAME: Provider Implementation
AD_WINDOW.DESCRIPTION: Links each Print Provider to the Java class that implements its printing logic.
AD_WINDOW.HELP:
This window is restricted to System Administrator roles. For every provider configured in Print Providers, register: 1. Module – the Etendo module that contains the connector code. 2. Java Implementation – fully-qualified class that implements PrintProviderStrategy.
If no implementation is found, printing will fail with “Provider implementation not defined”. Adding a new middleware requires only installing its connector module and creating a line here—no code changes in functional modules.

AD_WINDOW.NAME: Print Templates
AD_WINDOW.DESCRIPTION: Manage label templates by ERP table.
AD_WINDOW.HELP: Create the template scope: choose the Table (e.g., M_Product, M_InOut) and, if needed, a Provider. At runtime the system prefers a header; if none exists, it falls back to the global. Actual layouts are defined in the Template Lines tab.

AD_WINDOW.NAME: Printers
AD_WINDOW.DESCRIPTION: View-only catalogue of printers returned by the selected Print Provider.
AD_WINDOW.HELP: This window lists every printer fetched from the external middleware defined in Print Providers. Steps for administrators: -Choose a Provider in the filter combo (top left). -Click Update Printers to refresh the list; the system connects to the provider’s Printers GET URL and updates the grid. -Columns show Value (as reported by the provider), Name and Default flag. -Rows are read-only; add, edit or delete actions are disabled. Missing devices are marked Inactive automatically after each refresh.

AD_WINDOW.NAME: Print Providers
AD_WINDOW.DESCRIPTION: Stores the connection settings for each external printing middleware (PrintNode, CUPS gateway, Labelary, etc.) used by the organisation.
AD_WINDOW.HELP: Use this window to register a Print Provider per organisation. For every provider complete: -Name: Friendly display name (e.g. PrintNode – Main Plant). -Search Key: Unique code used by buttons and processes to reference the provider. -API Key: Authentication token (encrypted at rest). -Printers GET URL: Endpoint that returns the provider’s printer list. -Print POST URL: Endpoint that receives label print-jobs. -Active: De-activate to hide the provider from all drop-downs.
